channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Trump to impose more tariffs on Chinese goods
item.description: The US president announces fresh tariffs of 10% on another $300bn of Chinese products from 1 September.

item.title: North Korea launches third 'projectile' in eight days
item.description: The launches are seen as a reaction to planned military exercises between South Korea and the US.

item.title: Bionic arm for eight-year-old Mady Gardner
item.description: Eight-year-old Mady, the youngest recipient of a bionic arm in the US, requested it be bright pink.

item.title: Whaley Bridge dam collapse: Evacuation over Toddbrook Reservoir fears
item.description: Police tell Whaley Bridge's 6,500 residents to gather at a school amid fears a reservoir could burst.

item.title: Woman tells of six days trapped in crashed car
item.description: Corine Bastide spent six days trapped in her car, which crashed in the woods during the recent heatwave.

item.title: Milky Way galaxy is warped and twisted, not flat
item.description: New research shows our galaxy, the Milky Way, is twisted and warped - not flat as previously thought.

item.title: Pipeline explosion in Kentucky kills one worker
item.description: A pipeline explosion in the US has killed at least one worker and more are missing.

item.title: Alexandra Macesanu: Romanian girl’s 'calls for help released by family'
item.description: The family of a kidnapped Romanian girl claim police were slow to respond to her emergency calls.

item.title: Yemen war: Houthi missile attack on military parade kills 32
item.description: Missiles and an armed drone target pro-government forces in the city of Aden.

item.title: Bank of England cuts UK growth forecast
item.description: The Bank holds interest rates steady, but warns about the impact of a no-deal Brexit.

item.title: US Congress reaches deal to avert budget showdown
item.description: The US Senate follows the House of Representatives in approving big rises in federal spending.

item.title: Cambridge student who died in Madagascar 'opened plane door'
item.description: Cambridge University student Alana Cutland fell to her death in July.

item.title: Ashes: Superb Smith century rescues Australia
item.description: Steve Smith makes 144 on his return to Test cricket after the ball-tampering scandal to halt England's charge on the opening day of the Ashes.

item.title: First disabled lawmakers join Japan’s parliament
item.description: The lawmakers won seats in Japan’s upper house, in a sign of changing attitudes to disabled people.

item.title: In pictures: Russia's massive wildfires rage on
item.description: Images from Russia, where the army is helping to tackle wildfires in Siberia and other eastern regions.

item.title: China army video seen as warning to HK protestors
item.description: It appears to include footage filmed in Hong Kong, showing troops carrying out "anti-riot" exercises.

item.title: Hong Kong protesters on storming of the Legislative Council
item.description: Three protesters talk about what they see as a turning point in the current political movement.

item.title: Are you in your 30s and facing 'the swerve'?
item.description: Rachel Syme was astounded by how many other women aged 33-38 felt at a crossroads in their lives.

item.title: Democratic debate: Kool Aid, Clorox and the best one-liners
item.description: From well-rehearsed zingers to off-the-cuff comebacks, the debate answers that provoked a reaction.

item.title: Bumi Thomas: British-born jazz artist faces deportation from the UK
item.description: Bumi Thomas, a jazz artist who thought she was a British citizen, is now facing deportation from the UK.

item.title: Rescuing animals from the streets of Kiev
item.description: Photographer Thomas Machowicz pictures the work of the Kiev Animal Rescue Group.

item.title: Ebola: One year on from Democratic Republic Congo outbreak
item.description: Myths and conflict are hampering efforts to stop the disease spreading through a mobile population.

item.title: Bluey: The Australian cartoon that's going global
item.description: A cartoon about a family of dogs and the games they play is Australia's most streamed TV show.

item.title: Syria air strike sisters photo: Behind the image that shocked the world
item.description: Journalist Bashar al-Sheikh on capturing a Syrian family's harrowing moment after an air strike hit Idlib.

item.title: Eco tents at festivals: Would you sleep in a cardboard box?
item.description: Plastic tents are often left behind, and each one is the equivalent of around 250 plastic cups.

item.title: Only 35 cancer doctors for nation of 40m people
item.description: Recent high-profile deaths draw attention to cancer in a country which has just 35 oncologists.

item.title: Yemen war: Has anything been achieved?
item.description: Four years of conflict have left tens of thousands dead and no sign of peace, writes the BBC's Frank Gardner.

item.title: Hamza Bin Laden: Is al-Qaeda still a threat?
item.description: Are forces loyal to al-Qaeda still active around the world?

item.title: US-China trade war: 'We're all paying for this'
item.description: The US-China trade war is costing jobs and pushing up prices, say firms on both sides of the Pacific.

item.title: Fears stoke backlash against Venezuelans in Peru
item.description: Why some Peruvians fear that the recent influx of Venezuelans migrants poses a risk to their jobs.

item.title: VG Siddhartha: The coffee king of India
item.description: The death of coffee chain owner VG Siddhartha has sent shockwaves through India's business community.

item.title: England's Hull off to strong start at Women's British Open - highlights & report
item.description: England's Charley Hull has started strongly in her bid to win a first major title at the Women's British Open at Woburn.

item.title: 'Distraught' Anderson says sorry to England bowlers after injury
item.description: James Anderson apologised to the England bowlers for bowling only four overs because of a calf injury on day one of the opening Ashes Test.

item.title: Wolves ease to Europa League qualifier win over Crusaders
item.description: Wolves progress to the Europa League third qualifying round after a comfortable 4-1 victory over Crusaders secures a 6-1 aggregate win.

item.title: Ashes: Steve Smith rescues Australia against England on day one at Edgbaston
item.description: Australia's Steve Smith stars with a superb 144 as the tourists fight back from 122-8 to post 284 all out on day one of the first Test at Edgbaston.

item.title: Ashes: England's Stuart Broad dismisses Australia's David Warner
item.description: England's Stuart Broad dismisses Australia opener David Warner for just two as the hosts get a crucial breakthrough in the opening Test of the 2019 Ashes.

item.title: Rampant Aberdeen book date with Rijeka in Europa League
item.description: Sam Cosgrove scored a hat-trick as rampant Aberdeen earned a Europa League third qualifying round date with Rijeka by easing past Chikhura of Georgia.

item.title: Rangers into next round of Europa League after knocking out Progres
item.description: Rangers will play Danish side Midtjylland in the Europa League third qualifying round after completing a comfortable 2-0 aggregate win over Progres Niederkorn.

item.title: Red Sea Diving Resort: The holiday village run by spies
item.description: An idyllic holiday resort on the banks of the Red Sea was a base for Israeli spies with a secret mission.
